metadata.title: CVE-2019-11746 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur while manipulating video elementsif the body is freed while still in use. This results in a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69, Thunderbird <68.1, Thunderbird < 60.9, Firefox ESR < 60.9, and Firefox ESR < 68.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
